title: Black Mountain Cycles Road 2025 and Monstercross V6.1 Frames
content:
Black Mountain Cycles just announced the return of the Road model for 2025. This Molteni orange Merckx-tribute bike caught our eye, along with the Monster Cross V6.1 in khaki grey, both arriving in early June. Let’s check them out…

Black Mountain Cycles Road ’25

Rim brake road bikes ain’t dead. Mike Varley from Black Mountain Cycles shelved the Road model in 2020 and for 2025, he’s brought it back. A simple rim brake road bike like this very model is how Mike started his life of bicycles in 1984. It’s the type of bike he seems to always fall back on to.

The zen-like quality of riding on the road, just pedaling, hearing the tires sing on the tarmac, and feeling the wind on one’s face is what it’s all about. Since shelving the model, Mike always said that if there were enough demand, he would bring the Road frame back. And here it is. Could be a limited run or… let’s just say, never say never.

  • Sizes: 50cm, 53cm, 56cm, 59cm – sorry, tall riders, the minimum quantity per frame size is simply too high to justify ordering what would be a 5-year supply.
  • Light-weight 4130 cr-mo double-butted tubeset
  • Flat plate style crown
  • Mounts for front and rear fenders
  • Two sets of water bottle mounts
  • Investment cast rear dropout
  • Designed to fit 700c x 32 tires, 35mm max
  • Orange RAL 2011
  • Includes seat post clamp
  • 130mm rear spacing
  • Add a headset with your frame.  Installation is free with frame/headset purchase.
  • More info on the Road ’25 Tech page

The Road model is available as a frame for $875 or complete builds featuring Shimano 105 or Ultegra. Check out more at Black Mountain Cycles.

Black Mountain Cycles Monstercross V6.1

No bike can truly “do it all,” but these come darn close.  A cross bike is always on cyclists’ lists of “if I could only own one bike…”  This is Black Mountain Cycles’ “if I could only own one bike” bike.

The steel used in the cross frame is a heat-treated, double-butted 4130 chrome-moly tubing sourced from the leading steel tubing supplier in Taiwan.  The V6.1 frame differs from previous generations with a new fork crown from Long Shen – same twin plate style aesthetics with a bit more tire clearance.  Other features include clearance for up to 50 millimeters of rubber and horizontal dropouts to fine-tune chainstay length or run it as a single-speed.

  • NEW color Khaki Grey RAL 7008
  • NEW Long Shen twin-plate style crown
  • Sizes:  50cm, 53cm, 56cm, 59cm
  • Light-weight 4130 cr-mo double-butted tubeset
  • Mounts for front and rear racks and fenders
  • Three sets of water bottle mounts
  • Horizontal dropouts
  • Designed to fit 700c x 50 tires max
  • Includes seat post clamp
  • 132.5mm rear spacing
  • Add a headset with your frame.  Installation is free with frame/headset purchase.
  • More info on the Monstercross Tech page

The Road model is available as a frame for $875 or complete builds featuring Shimano or SRAM. Check out more at Black Mountain Cycles!
